title: Gerhard Rodax
text:
Gerhard Rodax (born 29 August 1965, in <a href="Tattendorf">Tattendorf</a>) is a former professional <a href="Football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player from <a href="Austria">Austria</a>.
Club career.
Rodax started his professional career at <a href="Admira%20Wacker">Admira Wacker</a> and stayed with them for 7 years, becoming <a href="Austrian%20Football%20Bundesliga">Austrian Football Bundesliga</a> top goalscorer in 1990. That earned him a contract at <a href="Spain">Spanish</a> side <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20de%20Madrid">Atlético de Madrid</a>, but he lasted only just over one season with them and returned to Austria to join <a href="SK%20Rapid%20Wien">Rapid Wien</a> where he finished his career in 1993 at 28 years of age. In the 1995/1996 season he made a short comeback at Admira.
International career.
He made his debut for <a href="Austria%20national%20football%20team">Austria</a> in 1985 and was a participant at the <a href="1990%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1990 FIFA World Cup</a>, where he scored in the 2–1 win over the <a href="United%20States%20men%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">USA</a> in <a href="Stadio%20Artemio%20Franchi">Florence</a>.
He won 20 international caps, scoring three goals. His last international was a May 1991 friendly match against <a href="Sweden%20national%20football%20team">Sweden</a>.
